channel.title: Programming on Geoffrey Tuttle
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Geoffrey Tuttle

item.title: Batch-Converting Video Files with Handbrake and Python
item.description: Over the past few years, I have acquired quite a video collection. Hundreds of files have been downloaded or DVDs ripped, resulting in nearly a terabyte of television and movies. I usually use Handbrake to rip files off a DVD, since it has several parameters that can be tweaked to give the ideal video output. I can easily name the file, specify an output format, and even create a queue for getting multiple videos from a disk.

item.title: 3d Scanner - MATLAB
item.description: For a project in my computational physics class, I wanted to create something more than a program. With an old webcam, a pantry turntable, and a cheap laser, I figured I could use MATLAB’s image processing abilities to create proof-of-concept 3d scanner. By centering the object on the turntable, and projecting the laser line onto the object, I can use the camera to collect images while rotating the object at known intervals.
